data.title: My four and six year olds love this place
data.text: I think it's great too as spilt up the time into 5 mins chucks and alternate between which kid gets to choose. There are a lot of different rooms there so the kids do not get bored (or I). My only two gripes are that their is too much space given to the model railway and some of the rooms are getting a little warn with age. Still got an annual membership though

data.title: Amazing
data.text: This place it the perfect place for young children especially if they have a lot of energy. It's nice not to have to worry about them touching everything. This is my son's favorite place to go!

data.title: Best for Children 10 and under
data.text: We chose to visit based on trip advisor, and the fact that we were looking for family fun. Like most places in the area,they do offer a military discount. This is a 2 level museum. There are lots of neat exhibits, and they are all interactive. As I stated, this is best for elementary aged and younger children. I feel that older children would not be as entertained. I would allow an hour and a half to 2 hours when planning.

data.title: Great hands on for all ages!
data.text: Visited the Portsmouth Children's museum when they had reciprocity if you had a Norfolk Zoo membership so it was a great deal.  Took my 3 yo (almost 4) granddaughter.  So much to do on all levels.  For example, she may not understand magnetism but the activities were lots of fun.  Her favorites are the grocery store, the tug boat, and the bus - we visited them multiple times!  It wasn't crowded so she had plenty of opportunity to participate in all the displays and everything is very 'hands on.'  We had so much fun pretending. Great to-do on a rainy day.

data.title: Zoo membership reciprocity in September
data.text: This place is fantastic. We took our 1 1/2 year old and there was plenty for her to do at her young age. Place seems clean and it wasn't overly crowded. In September Zoo members get in free!

data.title: One of the best children's museums nationwide
data.text: We have been to many children's museums nationwide and this one has to rank in the top 5. Many of the attractions are typical, such as the city street with a pretend bank, grocery store, etc, as well as the science section, but they also have a fabulous train layout, a section on saving energy in the home, about the beneficial bugs in the garden. If you are members of an ASTC affiliated organization, you can take advantage of the Passport program and get in free. Even if you can't, the admission is reasonable so long as you budget enough time to see everything. I would say the 'sweet spot' age for the museum is ages 3 to 11.

data.title: Great fun for everyone!
data.text: Such a fun experience for children of all ages.  Many great educational opportunities while having fun.

data.title: Family time
data.text: This is a decent entertainment for a family, but I believe the price is too high. The kids will enjoy every minute.

data.title: My child had fun
data.text: Staff is nice. They also have an affordable gift store. Lot's of things to do. Would have been nice if it had been more interactive and less based on just imagination.But the interactive stuff they did have was great....especially the bubble room. They also have a "make and take" art room. They give used book to every kid that comes through which was a kind hearted idea.

data.title: A Wonderful and Delightful Experience!
data.text: This is the second time we visited. Our child had fun and enjoyed hands on exploration of different genre's of every day life. When we last visited he was more a toddler and had a great time, and now as a preschooler it was as though it was a brand new experience and even more exciting. We went on a Sunday and the parking in the nearby garage was free on the weekend. I'm not sure at what age it would lose interest - perhaps somewhere in early elementary, but I recommend it for older toddlers and preschoolers. With the wristbands we were able to leave and walk down High St. to the Bier Garden for lunch (very good food!) and return to the museum.

data.title: Not enough activities/exhibits and expensive.
data.text: I've visited this museum at least 4 times in three years but I have been disappointed the last few times. The exhibits do not change much and it costs too much to take children here.

data.title: My brother sat in pee
data.text: Okay so first of all I think that this isn't actually the place where he sat in pee. We went to a Children's museum in Portsmouth, but I can't find that on here, so here we go: I love children's museums, I think they are super fun, and I'm 16. I went to the one in Portsmouth when I was 14 and my brother was 13 because we got a free coupon when we went to the train museum (which btw was barely even a museum it was a few trains on a table). But we went because, why not, and he went to sit down somewhere and sat in a puddle of pee. We had to buy him pants and CVS to wear for the rest of the day.

data.title: Fun indoors area for the kids
data.text: My kids enjoy going here and the hands on learing experience . They forget they are learning. Great place to beat the summer heat.

data.title: Great place for busy little ones
data.text: We have taken our boys here a few times and they always have a great time. It's great that they have so many different areas for the kids to play in with different activities upstairs too. One of the best things though is the area that's just for babies/toddlers. They even have s bathroom with changing room in it in that section- super helpful. The museum also gives lots of discounts which helps a lot. Definitely worth a stop!

data.title: Hands on fun for the kids
data.text: The facility was clean, bright, and innovative.  Definitely fun for the kids!  They had a blast and you can do the museum in less than 2 hours and park on the street.

data.title: Great fun had by all ages
data.text: One of the better children's museums that we have been to. Easy street parking. Great exhibits, fun and interesting. Would highly recommend, especially on a hot summer day. Also within easy walking distance of the Marriott.

data.title: Great place to spend a rainy or hot day
data.text:
We were passing through from the beach to Charlottesville Va and I have seen many posts on FB about this particular museum. We stopped and I'm glad we did. You could spend the whole opening hours in the museum. We spent about 3 but didnt get to the museum till 1pm. Just watch where you park. Street parking is 2 hours. No drinks or food inside. But right across the street is a coffee shop with pastries and sandwiches. I definitely recommend watching the planetarium show
 You do need to get tickets for this but it is FREE! LIMITED SPACE.  Also the crafts up stairs was fun for the whole family. I would definitely go back. Staff was friendly. They also have a great train display if you like that stuff.

data.title: Def worth the visit!
data.text: We stopped here today as we were traveling to Delaware. Our kids 12, 9, 8 and 18 months absolutely loved it and there was something for all of them to do! The train set is amazing and all the different set ups were so engaging for their little minds. I def recommend it to anyone traveling through Portsmouth!

data.title: LOTS to do!!
data.text: We've been to Children's Museums in a few different states, but this ranks up near the top! It is very well laid out and there are many things to do for kids of all ages. The bubble room was definitely a highlight for our kids who loved being inside their own bubble (our kids are 2 and 5). The train display was awesome, as was the "house" on the upper level. We went on Memorial Day and it was actually not very crowded at all - we were there for over 3 hours. Prices were very reasonable, and they do offer military and AAA discounts. We highly recommend coming here!!!

data.title: Fun place to take the grandkids
data.text:
Ok, I admit that I really wanted to go for myself as I'm the biggest kid in the family. Perhaps that's why my review was just average vs. something better. 

Keep in mind average for a children's museum is my comparison to other children's museums.  It's par for the course, and they do a nice job compared to others.  

It's worth visiting once and letting the kids play with the exhibits. 

Good for young kids 4 to 8
